result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Tywon Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marcus Tywon Mathews is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marcus Tywon Mathews was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All fines and costs are paid in full

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

12:48 - Defendant Marcus Tywon Mathews in court, in custody via video from DCJ with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (eligible).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court enters Not Guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $1000 Cash bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with SAB f/w dob 9/17/87 and her residence.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 1082 Bayberry Dr, Watertown WI 53098.   The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  
Defendant makes verbal request for substitution of judge. Court heard; informs will make note in record request was made but must be submitted in writing to proceed. Return date scheduled for October 26, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
